task_summary: Robot detects a T-shaped block and repeatedly pushes it toward a fixed goal region using a circular end-effector, with coarse and then orthogonal fine pushes.
assumptions: t_block and goal_region are visible or discoverable by scanning
workspace is planar and static during execution
short, repeated pushes are sufficient to reach the goal region

node_specs.description: Write a symbolic value to the blackboard.
Check visibility of a target object.
Active scan to locate a target.
Approach object and align tool for pushing.
Set end-effector yaw for push direction.
Execute a straight push along a cardinal direction.
Back off from the object after completion.

local_annotations.event: Initial approach over workspace; prepare to localize objects.
Target region visible; begin scanning/detection of T block.
First contact with T block; start push toward goal (leftward).
Yaw 90°; execute fine push toward alignment.
T block aligned with goal region; retreat.

recovery_strategy: change yaw to next cardinal direction and retry

expected_success_criteria: T block resides within goal_region outline after final push
test_scenarios: happy path with two coarse pushes and one fine push
